answers.answer: If you are experiencing nausea whenever you eat and feeling tired a lot you need to consult your doctor. First of all what do you mean by "they said I didn't have it". You need to see what your blood sugar is, fasting and two hours after meals. For your fasting anything over 100 is pre-diabetes and anything over 126 is diabetes.If you are not pre-diabetic or diabetic than you need to persist with your doctor and tell them you are not feeling well so they figure out what is going on.

question: This is not only about Diabetes, I just didnt know what to put it under.Anyways, I had type 2 diabetes two years ago because I was overweight. Then I got it under control and I am at a VERY normal weight and the docters said it went away, but I always have that tendency.So, now whenever I eat anything, I feel nauseous. I also have the symptoms of diabetes like, tiredness and things like that.Although, I went two weeks ago and got tests done at the docters and they said I didnt have it.What  is bothering me the most though, is not feeling good even if I just have a bite of something. The nauseousness only last about an hour then goes away.Any help??? Please!!! Thanks!
title: When I Eat
